page.title: 17ARMED FORCES
page.content: During World War Two Easter Ross had airfields from Evanton to Fearn. As well as having operationl anti-sub units it ws also a traning area for air gunners. The noise of planes using the Tain bombing range is still very much of a nuisance. The remains of buildings and runways are still stretching from Fearn aerodrome through Loans of Tullich to Ashfield.Fearn drome still has the occasional light plane land with civilian passengers and it is becoming important as an industrial site. The flight path of the bombers using the Tain range overflys part of our block. This range has been in use since 1934
